Class BlockDavidson

public class BlockDavidson
extends SparseEigensolver

SEIG Java BlockDavidson class.

SEIG uses the MTJ Java library (matrix-toolkits-java) and Netlib Java (netlib-java) for numerical linear algebra and matrix computations.

Author:
Rico Argentati

Method Detail

runBlockDavidson

public int runBlockDavidson(java.lang.Object... args)
Run Lobpcg

runLobpcg(X,A,B,T,Y,residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel)

X and Y are dense matrices, A, B and T may be operators or matrices X,A,B,T,Y must be in this order using "" for place holder if B or T or Y not needed residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel can be anywhere in the argument list but must be this order.

Example of how to call runLobpcg method with all arguments:
lobpcg.runLobpcg(X,operA,operB,operT,blockVectorY,residualTolerance,maxIterations,verbosityLevel);

Example of no operB or operT, but there is constraint matrix blockVectorY:
lobpcg.runLobpcg(blockVectorX,operA,"","",blockVectorY,1e-5,5,1);

Example of no operB but there is operT:
lobpcg.runLobpcg(blockVectorX,operA,"",operT);

Example of just two arguments:
lobpcg.runLobpcg(blockVectorX,operA);

see http://code.google.com/p/blopex/

Returns:
convergence status (1 if converged, -1 if did not converge)
